name: ETL / Database Engineer - Client Analytics
description:
In Deutsche Bank Technology Center we deliver software for internal users and external clients of corporate and investment bank.

Our team is building new Client Analytics & Insights MIS platform for Cash Management Business. We source the data from various data stores (Oracle, Hadoop, ClickHouse, Elastic Search, Glue API etc) and transform it in a different ways on T+1 basis. Transformation (Python, Conda, PL/SQL) is also including revenue forecasting.

With our platform the Product Coverage, Sales and I&S teams receive insights on product utilization and revenues.

We expect the successful candidate to become familiar with most of our stack and actively contribute to data feeds and platform design during his or her work. Next Year we are planning migration to Google Cloud Platform which is to be expected quite interesting and challenging journey for the team.

We are working in Agile way (Spotify model) and very closely aligned with our business colleagues. You shall expect to have regular meetings and close collaboration with them.

Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Full life-cycle of development tasks, starting from specification and design to successful implementation
  • Working in the global team following Agile development practices
  • Data Warehouse development and ETL design
  • Build and maintain SQL procedures and ETL processes with different tools and languages
  • Assistant in requirements gathering and data analytics as needed
  • Estimate work effort and assist to the Project Manager with task planning and LOE (level of effort) estimates
  • Contribute to the system architecture

Skills You’ll Need

  • 5+ years of experience in software development in the required technology streams
  • Strong knowledge of Python, Pandas , Numpy and Object Oriented Programming
  • Strong experience with data warehouse development and design. Extensive experience in ETL Concepts and framework including database design and performance optimization.
  • SQL, PL/SQL, NoSQL and experience to work with Oracle database is a must
  • Experience with Hadoop and Hadoop Ecosystem (Hive, Impala, Flume. Sqoop, Spark).
  • Experience with ML and time series forecasting (e.g. FBprophet, Arima) is desirable
  • Writing unit and integration tests for developed functionality
  • Experience in GIT, Apache Maven, JIRA and TeamCity is a must
  • UNIX command/shell scripting experience
  • Experience with Cloud solutions and especially with GCP is a big plus

What we offer

  • Flexible working hours
  • Partially remote work
  • Comfortable office located in the city center
  • Extended insurance package: medical and life insurance + partial coverage for spouse and children
  • Plenty of professional learning opportunities: English courses, professional trainings and certification, conferences participation
  • Relocation package (for new-joiners from other locations)
